alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 10:50AM EDT until September 14 at 2:09AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albany NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Housatonic River At Stevenson Dam affecting Fairfield and New Haven Counties. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River at Stevenson Dam. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 11.2 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.2 feet on 03/29/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Stevenson Dam Flood Stage: 11.0 Observed Stage at Wed 10 am: 10.2 Forecast: Wed 2 pm 11.2 Wed 8 pm 11.2 Thu 2 am 2.5 Thu 8 am 6.8 Thu 2 pm 2.5 Thu 8 pm 6.8 Fri 2 am 2.0 Fri 8 am 2.0 Fri 2 pm 2.0 Fri 8 pm 6.6 Sat 2 am 6.0 &&
